facts.1: Orthodox Christmas Day is celebrated on January 7th by many Orthodox Christians, following the Julian calendar.
facts.2: The day commemorates the birth of Jesus Christ and is marked by religious services, festive meals, and various customs.
facts.3: Orthodox Christmas traditions vary by country, but common practices include singing carols, exchanging gifts, and preparing special foods.

facts.1: National Bobblehead Day is celebrated on January 7th to honor the fun and quirky collectible figurines known as bobbleheads.
facts.2: Bobbleheads have been popular since the 1960s and feature a wide range of characters, from athletes to celebrities.
facts.3: The day encourages collectors and enthusiasts to showcase their bobblehead collections and share their favorite figures.

facts.1: National Tempura Day celebrates the Japanese dish of tempura, which consists of seafood and vegetables coated in a light batter and deep-fried.
facts.2: Tempura was introduced to Japan by Portuguese missionaries in the 16th century and has since become a beloved part of Japanese cuisine.
facts.3: The day encourages people to enjoy tempura at Japanese restaurants or try making it at home with various ingredients.
